Title: Software Engineer C++
Description:
Would you like to grow your talent and career in one of the most dynamic and innovative companies in the renewal energy sector globally?

Power Solutions & Vestas Quality > Applications, Controls & Electrical > PPC Applications

The Power Plant Controller Applications team is responsible for the design and implementation of control solutions, software architecture and technologies for the Vestas Power Plant Controller - A controller which is responsible to regulate certain parameters on the plant, with respect to the production of power. The development activities in the department include the development of power system engineering and controls software; embedded and real-time software; software release management and product support to colleagues in all regional Vestas' business units.

Responsibilities

The software engineer's main responsibilities would be to design, implement and test core functionalities for Vestas Power Plant Controller solution and to handle technical requests for plant control from Vestas regional business units and projects.

Qualifications

A master's degree in electrical engineering or SW Engineering or another engineering discipline that gives equivalent background knowledge and 3+ years of professional experience

Competencies

Working in the PPC Applications group naturally requires a solid technical understanding of C/C++ in an industrial setup. However, knowledge of another higher-level Object-Oriented Programming language like C# is also beneficial. Although not essential, perhaps you also have some experience in Matlab or Automation and control.

On a personal level, we expect that you have/are:

An open-minded and curious person with good communication skills combined with an innovative and problem-solving approach to carry out tasks
Aspiration to learn and ability to work with no supervision, efficiently and with persistence
Good cooperative skills suitable for a global organization with personal, professional, gender and cultural diversity.
Good verbal, written and spoken English skills are needed
Ability to take ownership and effectively engage in continuous improvements within a broader perspective
A team-oriented person who shows a enthusiastic approach to the tasks at hand and wants to contribute to the common achievements of the team

What we offer

You will be working with innovative technology that is constantly transforming companies including Vestas, testing the limits, and influencing people and processes. You will be a part of a highly committed and enthusiastic team motivated equally by creating business value and by developing innovative technical solutions.

We offer a diverse place where we promote your desire for constant learning opportunities. We offer an informal and agile workplace with a high level of freedom in defining the way forward.In this position you will be able to contribute with your experience to ensure high quality within your department and across the organization. Join Vestas and you will cultivate your career in an inspiring environment at a well-known wind turbine manufacturer with an ongoing commitment to sustainability.

We value personal initiative, the desire to take on responsibility, and the right balance between creativity and quality in all solutions.

Additional information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.




About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry‚Äôs global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore. Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field. With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution ‚Äì today, tomorrow, and far into the future. Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity. To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

Show more
HTML:
Would you like to grow your talent and career in one of the most dynamic and innovative companies in the renewal energy sector globally?

Power Solutions & Vestas Quality > Applications, Controls & Electrical > PPC Applications

The Power Plant Controller Applications team is responsible for the design and implementation of control solutions, software architecture and technologies for the Vestas Power Plant Controller - A controller which is responsible to regulate certain parameters on the plant, with respect to the production of power. The development activities in the department include the development of power system engineering and controls software; embedded and real-time software; software release management and product support to colleagues in all regional Vestas' business units.

Responsibilities

The software engineer's main responsibilities would be to design, implement and test core functionalities for Vestas Power Plant Controller solution and to handle technical requests for plant control from Vestas regional business units and projects.

Qualifications

A master's degree in electrical engineering or SW Engineering or another engineering discipline that gives equivalent background knowledge and 3+ years of professional experience

Competencies

Working in the PPC Applications group naturally requires a solid technical understanding of C/C++ in an industrial setup. However, knowledge of another higher-level Object-Oriented Programming language like C# is also beneficial. Although not essential, perhaps you also have some experience in Matlab or Automation and control.

On a personal level, we expect that you have/are:

  • An open-minded and curious person with good communication skills combined with an innovative and problem-solving approach to carry out tasks
  • Aspiration to learn and ability to work with no supervision, efficiently and with persistence
  • Good cooperative skills suitable for a global organization with personal, professional, gender and cultural diversity.
  • Good verbal, written and spoken English skills are needed
  • Ability to take ownership and effectively engage in continuous improvements within a broader perspective
  • A team-oriented person who shows a enthusiastic approach to the tasks at hand and wants to contribute to the common achievements of the team

What we offer

You will be working with innovative technology that is constantly transforming companies including Vestas, testing the limits, and influencing people and processes. You will be a part of a highly committed and enthusiastic team motivated equally by creating business value and by developing innovative technical solutions.

We offer a diverse place where we promote your desire for constant learning opportunities. We offer an informal and agile workplace with a high level of freedom in defining the way forward.In this position you will be able to contribute with your experience to ensure high quality within your department and across the organization. Join Vestas and you will cultivate your career in an inspiring environment at a well-known wind turbine manufacturer with an ongoing commitment to sustainability.

We value personal initiative, the desire to take on responsibility, and the right balance between creativity and quality in all solutions.

Additional information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.


About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry‚Äôs global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore. Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field. With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution ‚Äì today, tomorrow, and far into the future. Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity. To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

Title: Software Control Engineer
Description:
Do you get excited about working with a world team in an inspiring work environment?

Vestas Technology & Operations > Research & Development (R&D) > LaC Infrastructure

Through innovation, development, and continuous product improvement we develop the products and technologies that brings the highest possible value to our customers and to Vestas. Loads & Control (LaC) is responsible for designing and optimizing Vestas' products for optimal performance, loads and control strategies together with cross-product design work. The department consists of highly skilled, international, and well experienced engineers located across Portugal, Denmark, and India. In LaC Modelling & Infrastructure you will be taking full responsibility for developing SW solutions to enable simulation models for loads and power predictions which are efficient, scalable and with an adequate physical representation of Vestas WTG and Plant products. We have a sophisticated modelling environment that is closely interfaced with loads and control processes and activities and plays a vital role in overall product development and other value chain activities, as Vestas heavily relies on these to take critical business and product design decisions.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Software Engineer with a polyglot programming background to join our creative team. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in Python, MATLAB, and C#, with Delphi experience being a bonus. This role requires a minimum of 5 years of professional experience, and familiarity with the Agile framework is essential. Experience in the wind domain, particularly in loads and control software development, and any cloud environment will be highly advantageous.

Responsibilities

Develop, test, and maintain software applications using Python, MATLAB, C#, and optionally Delphi.
Collaborate with global teams to design, implement, and optimize software solutions.
Work as an individual contributor on complex projects, taking full ownership of the software development lifecycle.
Participate in Agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives.
Integrate software solutions with cloud environments and ensure seamless deployment.
Utilize wind domain knowledge, especially in loads and control software development, to enhance application performance and functionality.
Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code while following best practices and coding standards.
Conduct code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and mentor junior engineers.
Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve software defects and issues in a timely manner.
Continuously explore new technologies and frameworks to improve development processes and product quality.

Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
More than 2 years of professional software development experience.
Proficiency in Python, MATLAB, and C#.
Experience with Delphi is advantageous.
Strong understanding and experience with Agile methodologies.
Experience working in the wind domain is an added advantage.
Experience in loads and control software development is highly advantageous.
Familiarity with cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Advanced problem-solving skills and the ability to work individually and as part of a global team.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Competencies

Experience with version control systems such as Git.
Knowledge of software design patterns and principles.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automated testing frameworks.
Experience in developing and deploying microservices.
Understanding of data structures, algorithms, and performance optimization techniques.

What We Offer

We offer an opportunity to be part of a global team in an exciting business with a very comprehensive product range. The working environment in Loads & Control is informal but with clear direction. You will have the freedom to develop innovative solutions and actively support the department in setting the direction and principles of its digital transformation. You will be offered an attractive compensation package based on your qualifications and the demands of this position.

Additional information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.

Title: Test Automation Engineer
Description:
Who is Volkswagen Financial Services?

It's been more than 70 years since Volkswagen Financial Services AG financed the first Volkswagen vehicles in Germany in 1949. A lot has changed since then, but our core goal hasn't; ensuring we meet the mobility needs of the people.

Volkswagen Financial Services today operates in 48 markets through its various subsidiaries, shareholdings, and joint ventures. Volkswagen Financial Services is the largest provider of automotive financial services worldwide.




At VWFS Porto, we are proud to foster a gender-equal workplace, where diversity is celebrated, and every individual is provided with equal opportunities to thrive and succeed.




Objectives:

As a member of the VWFS Porto test team, you will be responsible for developing test automation solutions for projects and initiatives ensuring the highest ROI is achieved, as well as maintaining and extending existing automation suites. You will work alongside VWFS test automation engineers as well as 3rd party colleagues both Onsite and Offshore.




In this role you will be responsible for:

Planning, developing, and executing automated test cases
Working with Agile methodologies together with BDD development practices
Monitoring test executions in the CI pipeline
Reporting results to the testing team and stakeholders
Ongoing maintenance of automated regression packs
Participating in root cause analysis activities for defects found
Working with Project teams to ensure any planned changes to functionality are covered by the regression test suite
Assessing impact to new or changes to existing functionality
Review and prioritize requests for automation
Participating in code reviews with other Test Automation Engineers to ensure test scripts meets the coding standards
Collaborating with global teams and 3rd party suppliers
Researching and reviewing tools that can benefit existing ways of working
Advocate for quality within VWFS teams.




Level of decision-making power/authorization:

Allocation of work to test automation engineers both onsite and offshore
Supporting proposals for further automation
Technical decisions on how best to automate
Proposing new tools, methods, processes to improve quality of the Technical Test function.




We believe that the right profile for this job should have / be:

Bachelor or master‚Äôs degree in informatics, computer science or comparable
Previous experience in design, development, and execution of automated & manual test scripts
Strong working knowledge with frameworks like Playwright or Selenium
Solid knowledge using OOP languages like C#, Java or JavaScript and IDE‚Äôs such as Visual Studio Code
Experience working with BDD (Behaviour Driven Development) technologies (Cucumber, SpecFlow)
Experience in using application lifecycle management tools (JIRA, ALM, Azure devops) and version control systems (GIT)
Previous experience with CI/CD pipelines like Jenkins, ADO pipelines or TeamCity
High degree of initiative, responsibility, assertiveness, and willingness to travel
Positive and team-minded person with effective communication and presentation skills
Speaks & writes English fluently




Nice to have:

ISTQB certifications
API testing skills
Experience in working in an international team/ project team
Knowledge in two or more of the following areas: Wholesale or Retail Financing, Leasing and Fleet Business.




What we Offer:

Long-term contract
Competitive package including private health insurance, life insurance and meal allowance (pay by meal card)
Bonuses and benefits depending on performance
Schooling allowance and Pension Scheme
Incredible and unique annual company events
Opportunity to work on an international project and be part of multicultural and multidisciplinary team
Solid performance evaluation and career management methodologies
Continuous training ‚Äì technical and behavioral development.

Title: Mid GOLANG Developer (HYBRID @Porto)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: GOLANG Developer

Seniority: Mid

Type of position: HYBRID in Porto




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
Between 2-4 years of experience in software development with GOLANG.
Proficiency in Go and its standard library.
Experience with RESTful APIs and microservices architecture.
Familiarity with version control systems, preferably Git.
Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases.
Understanding of concurrency and parallelism in Go.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English is mandatory.
Availability for a HYBRID regime in Porto.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefer the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Software Engineer - Cloud & AI
HTML:
Vortex-CoLab is a growing collaborative laboratory that brings together academia and industry partners in an innovation framework to drive technology transfer in cyber-physical systems and cybersecurity. We are embarking on a journey that brings together cutting-edge research and engineering to create world-class demonstrators and proofs of concepts to drive high levels of software and hardware assurance. To support this journey, we are actively seeking a Software Engineer with a focus on Cloud and AI to join our team.

WHO?

Requirements

VORTEX-CoLab is looking for an exceptional Software Engineer - AI/ML Software Engineer with BSc/MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar, specializing in AI/ML Software Engineer technologies with a strong emphasis on data analytics and that gathers the following requirements:

  • 4-6 years of professional experience in software development;
  • Experience with at least one major cloud provider's AI/ML platform (e.g., Google Cloud Vertex AI, Microsoft Azure AI/Machine Learning, or AWS SageMaker);
  • Proficiency in AI frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch;
  • Nice to have Experience with the Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana);
  • Familiarity with CI/CD systems and best practices;
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to be independent preferably with coaching experience, collaborative environment;
  • Experience in Agile methodologies in particular scrum.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders;
  • Experience with version control systems, specifically Git.

WHAT?

As an AI/ML Software Engineer at Vortex-CoLab, you will work with a cross-functional team of other researchers and engineers to support R&D projects related to our innovation team in perception activities as well as robotics and advanced simulations.

How You Can Expect To Fill Your Days

  • Implement and integrate cloud-based AI/ML solutions on platforms like Google Cloud Vertex AI, Microsoft Azure AI/Machine Learning, or AWS SageMaker;
  • Design, develop, and maintain AI-driven software solutions using AI frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch;
  • Utilize data ingestion, storage, and analysis tools to manage and analyze large datasets;
  • Work with CI/CD systems to automate and streamline the development process;
  • Perform data fusion from multiple sources to create comprehensive data models and insights;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of software components;
  • Apply Agile methodologies, particularly Scrum, to manage and deliver projects effectively.
  • Continuously learn and adapt to new technologies and domains as required by projects.
  • Coach and mentor junior team members, fostering a collaborative and supportive work environment.
  • Communicate technical concepts effectively to non-technical stakeholders.

WHY?

If your true calling is to work at the forefront of applied R&D, and if you're passionate about prototyping breakthrough technologies with applications, then we should talk. We are looking for candidates with an interest in innovative research and a commitment to developing practical applications.

Vortex-CoLab brings together motivated individuals and active learners who thrive on doing unusual things every day. Together, we tackle technological challenges with both scientific rigor and commercial awareness to deliver high quality prototypes that may transform the use of technology in the real world.

Rewards & Benefits

  • Health insurance for the whole family
  • Flexible working environment
  • Extra days off
  • Training opportunities
  • EU Salary Range: 26.500 EUR ‚Äì 35.000 EUR (salary range can change if hired in at a different level)

Title: ES ‚Äì Engenheiro ADAS Software- Matlab and Simulink para trabalhar em Espanha (Valladolid)
Description:
We want to be your first choice!




We know that you want to grow professionally, that you want to face new challenges... we just need to know if working with the latest technology in the automotive sector can motivate you. Is that the case?

Look no further, that's us.




We are currently immersed in a selection process for several profiles with experience in handling Matlab and Simulink, to work on a powerful project ADAS, for one of the world's leading vehicle manufacturers.




What tasks will you be able to perform in this role?

Analyse system requirements
Define these requirements at component level
Component software development. MBD design
Design the new functionality in Matlab/Simulink
MIL validation
Agile methodologies, C, C++
Create control laws
Create or update validation scenarios
Analyse simulation results and report anomalies
You will also have the role of contributing to technical development in this area.




Requirements:

Computer Engineer, Telecommunications/Electronics/Electronics/Mechatronics/Mathematics/Aeronautics...etc.
Experience in MBD design - MIL validation is highly valued.
Experience in Matlab/Simulink, C and C++
Phyton is a plus
GitLab, Jira
Languages: Spanish - high English essential (communication and writing). French is a plus
Problem solving skills, creativity.
High communication skills




What we offer:

Indefinite contract.

Continuous language training.

Technical training.

HTML:
We want to be your first choice!


We know that you want to grow professionally, that you want to face new challenges... we just need to know if working with the latest technology in the automotive sector can motivate you. Is that the case?

Look no further, that's us.


We are currently immersed in a selection process for several profiles with experience in handling Matlab and Simulink, to work on a powerful project ADAS, for one of the world's leading vehicle manufacturers.


What tasks will you be able to perform in this role?

  • Analyse system requirements
  • Define these requirements at component level
  • Component software development. MBD design
  • Design the new functionality in Matlab/Simulink
  • MIL validation
  • Agile methodologies, C, C++
  • Create control laws
  • Create or update validation scenarios
  • Analyse simulation results and report anomalies
  • You will also have the role of contributing to technical development in this area.


Requirements:

  • Computer Engineer, Telecommunications/Electronics/Electronics/Mechatronics/Mathematics/Aeronautics...etc.
  • Experience in MBD design - MIL validation is highly valued.
  • Experience in Matlab/Simulink, C and C++
  • Phyton is a plus
  • GitLab, Jira
  • Languages: Spanish - high English essential (communication and writing). French is a plus
  • Problem solving skills, creativity.
  • High communication skills


What we offer:

Indefinite contract.

Continuous language training.

Technical training.

Medical insurance (Optional)

Team Building activities.



We are BERTRANDT, and you?

We are waiting for you!

Title: Software Engineer II
Description:
Based in Portugal and ideally Porto, you'll report into a tech lead and be an instrumental part in the creation of next-generation software solutions for Threads. Psychological safety is at the very heart of who we are. We work in Agile squads who are open and value continuous improvement and sharing knowledge.

We are integrating our client and internal systems to create a next-generation solution to help us to lead in luxury omni-channel commerce in the fashion industry.

Requirements


Knowledge in developing solutions using javascript or typescript
Commercial experience using client-side Javascript, CSS and HTML5
Knowledge in either React development patterns and related tools or in developing services and API's using Node.js
Experience with the tooling involved in building modern web and mobile applications (bundlers, Linters, ES6, testing frameworks)
A basic knowledge of concepts concurrency and asynchronous actions



Technical Abilities


At Threads, we always aim to use the best tool for the job. Today's stack includes, but isn't limited to: TypeScript, Node.js, Postgres, React, React Native, GraphQL, Docker, Terraform, and AWS

Title: Software Developer
Company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
Description:
Do you want to shape the future for green energy?

Vestas Technology & Operations > Research & Development > Plant Performance & Reporting

Plant Performance & Reporting is a sub department of Modelling & Analytics module with 30 employees, across several locations. The department is expanding in Porto, Portugal is expected to be 4 people by end of this year. In office, the team will be seated with colleagues from neighboring departments.

Plant Performance & Reporting department is responsible for the continued development of several data driven applications, which run centrally in Vestas's datacenter or as cloud deployments. Our applications typically integrate and operate on huge amounts of data from various sources to bring value for both internal- and external customers. We continuously work to raise the bar for quality and usability in the delivered software applications. We seek to implement lovable solutions.

Across the Modelling and Analytics department, we use SAFe for our agile prioritization and execution.

You will be one of the key drivers of designing and implementing the software solutions built in Plant Performance & Reporting. You will be involved in projects from initial requirements through development to support and maintenance, as part of a team that pursues a DevOps strategy.

Responsibilities


Take initiative in collaborating with coworkers to ensure everyone progresses at an equitable pace
Deliver modern, high quality software solution within the agreed time and quality
Transform requirements from stakeholders and UX designers into generic user-friendly software solutions
Participate in designing and implementing systems with focus on 99.99% uptime, lovability, IT security and maintainability
Keep focus on testability and delivering quality products
Keep yourself up to date on relevant technology



Qualifications


Relevant IT education, minimum at Bachelor level
2-5 years of experience working professionally with complex C# development in larger application development projects



Competencies


C#/.NET v6/8
Kafka or similar
Microservice architecture and technologies
Kubernetes (Argo and Rancher)
Azure DevOps and Azure fundamentals
Redis or similar
SQL- & NoSQL- Servers
Scripting (PowerShell, Bash)
NUnit / Moq test frameworks



Experience in some of the following areas would be beneficial:


Prometheus / Grafana
Event sourcing
Angular Frontend development
Scrum, and working in an agile team
Jira
Continues Delivery
Octopus Deploy
Linux / Windows servers



Language Skills


Fluent English (Writing and oral)



What We Offer


We offer you an exciting opportunity to attain responsibility for data-driven applications, critical to both our customers and Vestas
You will use the latest technologies supporting Vestas's goals which also stretch far into the digital world
You will have excellent opportunities for cross disciplinary technical - and personal development
A good work-life balance with particularly good options for supporting your best mix of work- and family time



Additional Information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.

BEWARE - RECRUITMENT FRAUD

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB Statement

At Vestas, we recognize the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry's global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution - today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.
